longer complete when I add an "assertEquals(...)" at the end.

that indicates the test didn't run:

Created an attachment (id=29013)
View-based session test

This session test "correctly" fails on 3.1.0, but doesn't complete with the
above errors on 3.2 from HEAD.

PW

With the java test I actually attached, the console failure is:

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed:
Unexpected message: org.eclipse.ui.views.ProgressView
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:107)
	at

PW

The assertion that fails at the end of
SessionTestRunner.ResultCollector#processMessage() should be deleted. I tried to
be smart and catch invalid messages, but turns out that if there is a way of
doing that properly, it is not be as simple as the way it is implemented.
Luckily, it only happens when the tests actually fail.

Paul, could you confirm that doing the change suggested works for you?

I commented out that line, and now my test "correctly" fails with a
ComparisonFailure and the unequal info.

PW
I released the fix into HEAD. JohnA agreed to put it in for M3.
